result.execSummary:
The defendant Eugene M. Paura was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Kimberly N, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Have no violent contact with CP (dob 11/20/98).  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eugene M. Paura

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Eugene M. Paura, appeared with Attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.   Court costs & surcharge ordered.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Kimberly N. unless permitted by either the court or the agent and no violent threatening contact with C.P.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Eugene M. Paura, appeared with Attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Clerk: PT
Atty Dimmer moves to withdraw as counsel.  DE states he is prepared to proceed with a plea at this time and requests Atty Dimmer continue as counsel.  Atty Dimmer withdraw's his motion to withdraw and requsts a moment off the record.  Parties appear back on the record and case is resolved.  State is compliant with victim rights notification.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.
to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Dimmer
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Thomas Binger  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Brian Dimmer.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. is in treatment, to be completed by 5/15/16.  At this time, case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 4/14/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 4/18/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Brian Dimmer.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  At the request of Atty Dimmer, FPT adj. to 1/28/16 at 8:40.  Bond continued.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
